free_text.Learning outcomes: Understand how to solve certain discrete-time general-equilibrium models. The course is articulated around 8 lectures.
free_text.Content: Lecture 1: Euler equation, Bellman Principle, Solving Euler equation in Gaussian case, Solving Euler equation via fixed-point techniques (value-function iteration) in univariate case.[br/]Lecture 2: Solving Euler equation via fixed-point techniques (value-function iteration) in multivariate case. Discussion of paper by Tauchen (JBES), Tauchen and Hussey (E'Metrica). Discussion of Campbell-Cochrane (2000).[br/]Lecture 3: Behavioral in General Equilibrium: Explaining volatility, explaining skewness and kurtosis. Discussion of Barberis Huang and Santos. [br/]Lecture 4: Portfolio allocation in a discrete dynamic setting. Discussion of MacQueen and Vorkink. A digression into Corporate Finance: Discussion of Hennessy and Whited (2005), Debt Dynamics.[br/]Lecture 5: Bayesian techniques into a portfolio-allocation setting. Introduction to Bayesian techniques (prior, posterior). Discussion of Barberis (1999)[br/]Lecture 6,7: Predicting returns (Cochrane: discussion of paper on barking dogs). How to deal with ambiguity.[br/]Lecture 8:  Questions and answers[br/]
free_text.Keywords: Equilibrium Models, Asset Pricing, Integration, Discrete Dynamic Programming
